item.title: Projects
item.description: Below is a list of all projects that are hosted on this blog. Projects are a subset of sections.

item.title: Making a Vulnerable Webapp
item.description: Welcome to Part One in a three part series that I’ve called “service-to-shell”. I want to make a vulnerable webapp that I can scan with a custom nmap probe and exploit with a custom Metasploit module. This post covers making the vulnerable webapp - not as exciting as a custom Metasploit module or as useful as an additional nmap banner scanner, but an essential part of the process. For making a vulnerable webapp, the first step is to pick the language (I went with Python), then the vulnerability (Command injection - it’s simple to write and understand), and finally the theme.

item.title: About Author
item.description: I like to work at the intersection of Security and Automation. I enjoy building content and training. The blog is a work in progress - trying to get the pipeline working well. Expect some oddities (missing images, notes in posts)

item.title: All Sections
item.description: Below is a list of all sections in this blog along with a short description. Sections includes projects.

item.title: Intro Post
item.description: Welcome. This is my blog for the time being. Content Expect content to be: projects I work on, stuff I do, focused on tech. Hosting The address (connorshade.com) should never change, but the theme and hosting provider may. Right now I’m “hosting” on Github pages - posts are built with Hugo and I’m using the bear cub theme because it seems simple enough. I tried to use Gruvbox but the idea of installing nvm to install node to install npm to install >100 dependencies to compile a webpage is disgusting, despite how nice the page looks.
